md:
giải nghĩa từ "selection" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

* Selection (noun) - sự lựa chọn
	+ Meaning: the act of choosing something or someone from a group of possibilities.
	+ Example: "The selection of the new employee was based on her excellent qualifications."
	+ Related words: choose, pick, elect, appoint, preference.

* Selection (noun) - tuyển chọn
	+ Meaning: a group of things or people that have been chosen from a larger group.
	+ Example: "The selection of wines at the restaurant was impressive."
	+ Related words: collection, assortment, choice, variety, range.

* Selection (noun) - lựa chọn tự nhiên
	+ Meaning: the process by which the best or most suitable individuals or organisms are chosen to survive or reproduce.
	+ Example: "Natural selection is the driving force behind evolution."
	+ Related words: adaptation, evolution, survival, fitness, genetics.

* Select (verb) - chọn
	+ Meaning: to choose something or someone from a group of possibilities.
	+ Example: "I selected the red shirt from the closet."
	+ Related words: pick, choose, elect, appoint, prefer.

* Selective (adjective) - chọn lọc
	+ Meaning: carefully choosing or selecting something or someone.
	+ Example: "The company is selective in its hiring process."
	+ Related words: discerning, picky, choosy, particular, fastidious.

* Selectivity (noun) - tính chọn lọc
	+ Meaning: the quality of being selective or careful in choosing something or someone.
	+ Example: "The university is known for its selectivity in admitting students."
	+ Related words: discernment, discrimination, taste, refinement, sophistication.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "selection" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  • Selection (noun) - sự lựa chọn

    • Meaning: the act of choosing something or someone from a group of possibilities.
    • Example: "The selection of the new employee was based on her excellent qualifications."
    • Related words: choose, pick, elect, appoint, preference.

  • Selection (noun) - tuyển chọn

    • Meaning: a group of things or people that have been chosen from a larger group.
    • Example: "The selection of wines at the restaurant was impressive."
    • Related words: collection, assortment, choice, variety, range.

  • Selection (noun) - lựa chọn tự nhiên

    • Meaning: the process by which the best or most suitable individuals or organisms are chosen to survive or reproduce.
    • Example: "Natural selection is the driving force behind evolution."
    • Related words: adaptation, evolution, survival, fitness, genetics.

  • Select (verb) - chọn

    • Meaning: to choose something or someone from a group of possibilities.
    • Example: "I selected the red shirt from the closet."
    • Related words: pick, choose, elect, appoint, prefer.

  • Selective (adjective) - chọn lọc

    • Meaning: carefully choosing or selecting something or someone.
    • Example: "The company is selective in its hiring process."
    • Related words: discerning, picky, choosy, particular, fastidious.

  • Selectivity (noun) - tính chọn lọc

    • Meaning: the quality of being selective or careful in choosing something or someone.
    • Example: "The university is known for its selectivity in admitting students."
    • Related words: discernment, discrimination, taste, refinement, sophistication.
